channel.title: Combined Politepol Feed
channel.description: Merged feed from multiple Politepol sources

item.title: Why has India cleared Dulhasti hydel project on Chenab? Why is Pakistan protesting it?
Donald Trump is taking more daily aspirin than doctors recommend. Is this safe?
Have Iranians had enough of Ayatollah Khamenei? Inside the sweeping protests taking over Iran
How water contamination in Indore killed residents, including 6-month-old
Inside Crans-Montana, the ski resort town at centre of deadly New Year’s fire
Why did New York City's Zohran Mamdani take his mayoral oath on the Quran?
India’s Bangladesh policy must prioritise strategic restraint, diversified diplomacy
item.description: The coming months are critical for India to recalibrate its Bangladesh policy, emphasising engagement with moderate political actors and addressing security concerns to avert a deeper strategic setback

item.title: Was Jeffrey Epstein untouched for years due to ‘ties’ with intel agencies?
item.description: The sex offender had unprecedented access and influence spanning several American presidencies

item.title: Ten global shocks that shaped 2025, and will define 2026
item.description: The year 2025 was marked by a series of shocks—from climate extremes and war to technological disruption and geopolitical instability—that reshaped the global order and will continue to define the world in 2026

item.title: Ramification | Bangladesh: When law collapses, the mob takes charge
item.description: As per the statement of an MEA spokesperson, more than 2,900 incidents of violence against minorities have been documented by independent sources during the tenure of the interim government

item.title: Why US is so obessed with Greenland
item.description: Resource rich Greenland is geographically part of North America, just off Canada’s coast, with its nearest European neighbour, Iceland, about 200 miles across the Denmark Strait—making it indispensable for the US

item.title: When the world gets richer, inequality becomes uglier: Why India cannot escape the trend
item.description: When economies boom, the gains rarely trickle down. Around the world, the top one per cent surges ahead while the bottom half struggles. India is unlikely to be the exception, no matter how much hue and cry the critics of the government of the day make.
